page.title: 05The Parish Church Choir.
page.content: In the church choir there are twelve children and sixteen adults.The age range is from seven to over eighty.We have to wear a blue or black cassock and white surplice and ruff.These are put on in the vestry. We have two organs,a small one in the vestry and the main organ next to the choir stalls.Miss Smith plays the organ.The main services which are the ones that the choir sing,are on Sunday mornings. At the family service the junior choir sit in the front pews and at Eucharist they go up to receive communion.Some sundays we have Mattins which involves singing a lot of psalms.On Friday at seven o'clock the children have their choir practice taken by Mr.Smith.We have about fifty weddings a year for which we are paid 50p. On special occasions we sing an anthem and at weddings we often sing Crimmond.
